Tonight, there are reports that hold-out states are close to a deal that would allow a settlement to be announced as early as tomorrow.

Well, it's a deal that will extract some penalties from the banks, about $25 billion, if all states sign on.

So, who actually benefits from the money that the banks will pay?
Where would it go?

But the banks would still have a lot of discretion in who gets what.
